resource.name: CalEnviroScreen3.0SHP
resource.description: In January 2017, the Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment (OEHHA), on behalf of the California Environmental Protection Agency (CalEPA), released Version 3.0 of the California Communities Environmental Health Screening Tool (CalEnviroScreen). CalEnviroScreen identifies California communities by census tract that are disproportionately burdened by, and vulnerable to, multiple sources of pollution.

resource.name: Richmond Community Survey
resource.description: In January 2007, the City of Richmond enrolled in the National Research Center’s (NRC) National Citizen Survey (NCS) program in order to conduct a resident survey to help the City Council set spending priorities and to set a benchmark of city service delivery. The City conducts a survey every two years.

columns_description: Pounds of litter are often not feasible to measure. This metric, in general, also does not include waste that cannot fit in bags, such as bulky items.

Mini-grant: project was funded by a Love Your Block mini-grant and led by resident, community member, or organization. Collaboration: project was supported by Love Your Block.  Special project: project was led or co-led by Love Your Block.
Refers to fiscal year period (6/30/2017 = Fiscal Year 2016-2017). The Love Your Block program began in June 2015 so data is measured on a fiscal year basis.
Includes public art and painted objects
Calendar year during which the project took place
Number of work days for the project

resource.name: Richmond Police Department - Police Pursuits
resource.description:
Officers engaged in police pursuits must continually balance the safety of the public and themselves against law enforcement's duty to apprehend law violators. Officers must discontinue a pursuit whenever circumstances indicate that continuation of the pursuit would be unsafe or when life or property is endangered.

This dataset shows vehicle pursuit data provided to the California Highway Patrol.
columns_description: Total cost of damage to police vehicles
Whether there was aircraft available to assist
Whether there was a helicopter available to assist
Number of officers involved/associated with the pursuit
Which Richmond Police Department team/group was involved in the pursuit
Total cost of damage to suspect vehicles
Type of damage from the accident
Whether a stop device was used
Total time of the pursuit in minutes
Total cost of damage to other property
Whether there was a DUI arrest
Violation reason for engaging in a pursuit
Total cost of damage to other parked vehicles
Type of injury from the accident

resource.name: Richmond Police Department - Firearm Discharge Incidents
resource.description:
Officers are authorized to use deadly force to protect themselves or the public when facing an imminent threat of death or serious bodily injury. This dataset shows incidents where police officers discharged (fired) their firearm. 

Only incidents with Access Levels 3 and 5 are general access and approved for the public (other incidents are confidential and have limited access for Internal Affairs only).
columns_description: Whether the target involved an animal that was killed
Whether the target involved an animal
Number of shots fired that missed the target
Whether there was injury, and who caused it
Number of shots fired by the officer(s)
Number of shots fired by the citizen(s)
Number of shots fired that hit the target
Whether the firearm discharge was intentional
Whether the target involved an animal that was injured

resource.name: 2019 Achieve Summer Camp Literacy Gains Data
resource.description: Literacy gains are based on the San Diego Quick Assessment, which assesses the reading grade level of students. Students are given sets of words to read, with each set based on a reading grade level. The score corresponds to the reading grade level at which the student makes 1 or less mistake (Independent); 2 mistakes (Instructional); or 3 or more mistakes (Frustration).
columns_description: Instructional Score is the reading grade level at which the student makes 2 errors. Kindergarten = 0 and Pre-k = -1
Frustration score is the reading grade level at which the student makes 3 errors or more. Kindergarten = 0 and Pre-k = -1
Independent Score is the reading grade level at which the student makes 1 error or less. Kindergarten = 0 and Pre-k = -1
Instructional Score is the reading grade level at which the student makes 2 errors. Kindergarten = 0 and Pre-k = -1
Independent Score is the reading grade level at which the student makes 1 error or less. Kindergarten = 0 and Pre-k = -1
Frustration score is the reading grade level at which the student makes 3 errors or more. Kindergarten = 0 and Pre-k = -1

resource.name: Public Asset Inventory
columns_description: Last update of tabular data only, will not reflect metadata or shapefiles
if the row represents a view/map/data_lens page etc. that is derived from another dataset = True
if data is federated, the source domain will populate here
The source of the provided data
The source link of the provided data
if the row represents a view/map/data_lens page etc. the underlying parent dataset UID populates

Has four possible values:

    * Unpublished: Does not show up in catalog. Waiting to be published.
    * Published: The authoritative and broadly available current copy of a dataset
    * Snapshotted: An older copy of the dataset which has been saved for reference
    * Copying: A dataset which is in the process of being copied internally. This is an ephemeral state.

The score corresponds to the reading grade level at which the student makes 1 or less mistake (Independent); 2 mistakes (Instructional); or 3 or more mistakes (Frustration).

RPD Pursuits - Top Pursuit Conclusions (2015 - Present)
resource.description:
Officers engaged in police pursuits must continually balance the safety of the public and themselves against law enforcement's duty to apprehend law violators. Officers must discontinue a pursuit whenever circumstances indicate that continuation of the pursuit would be unsafe or when life or property is endangered.

This dataset shows vehicle pursuit data provided to the California Highway Patrol.
